concept.title: Learnings
concept.shortdesc: Short questions and answers about creating content for the decentralized web.

dlentry.dt: How did you make this dwebsite?

dd.p: At the very start, I had a thousand questions and started a design doc and committed to writing a log to capture the general process.
The source content is written in OASIS Open DITA XML.
It is transformed to HTML5 using the DITA Open Toolkit 4.2.3 via Github Actions.
Python massages the HTML5 so it plays nicely with Bulma CSS.
Bulma CSS on a CDN provides responsive layout and UX
Fleek is the platform and application host and get the content onto the InterPlanetary File System (IPFS).

dlentry.dt: Do I need to use Content Identifiers in my XML/Markdown/HTML?
dlentry.dd: Nope. Don't even try. There's zero benefit AFAIC.

dlentry.dt: What processes need to change if you want to publish content to IFPS?
dlentry.dd: None. Using Fleek as my platform provider, meant that I could simply auto-deploy from Git. When experimenting with the DWeb YVR chat app, I used the Fleek CLI. Having Fleek handle the entire IPFS layer is a happy path.

dlentry.dt: How much do I need to think about security and encryption? Or is it auto-magical?
dlentry.dd: It is auto-magical HTTPS - deploying from Fleek.

dlentry.dt: How do I deploy a dweb site?
dlentry.dd: Select a platform provider or you can publish directly onto IPFS yourself.

dlentry.dt: How do I make the references to graphics, should I be using CIDs rather than URLs?
dlentry.dd: No, stick to meaningful and human-readable names.

Search is a rabbit hole. Something like the Graph should be all I need, but I went and wasted time fiddling with Elastic search and Alogolia. Soon, there will be a function search box that's using dweb-based search.
